note: Verifes that the SDB tool will display help when no args are supplied
Verifies that the SDB tool will display help when the help switch only is supplied
Verifes that the SDB tool will display available mode when the -l switch is supplied
Verifes that the SDB tool will display the tool version number when the -v switch is supplied.
Verifes that the SDB tool will display debug output when the -d switch is used
Verifies that the SDB tool supports the SQLite mode
Verifies that the SDB tool supports the DBMS mode
Verifies that the SDB tool allows an update of a database specified by the -i switch
Verifes that configuration information can be applied using the -c switch
Verifes that the output location can be specified using the -o switch
Verifies that the SDB tool is POSIX compliant (SDB/Command line interface/001)
Partial verification of tool renaming from SQLite Creator to SDB/Symbian Database Creator (SDB/Command line interface/002)
Verifies that the major version number of the tool is 2. (SDB/Command line interface/003)
Verifes that the SDB tool will display debug output when the -d switch is used (SDB/Command line interface/004)

Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m sqlite and no further input. SDB will create a SQLite DB containing just an empty Symbian settings table. It will be created at the default location as described by the property “sdb.dbname”. (SDB/DB Creation/001)

Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m sqlite and specifies a configuration file containing platsec policy definitions with the –c switch. SDB will create a new SQLite DB at the default location as described by the property “sdb.dbname”. The DB will contain the tables and values corresponding to the platsec settings specified and the Symbian settings table. SDB/DB Creation/002

Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m sqlite and specifies a configuration file containing database configuration setting, with the –c switch. SDB will create a new SQLite DB at the default location as described by the property “sdb.dbname”. A new DB will be created with the configuration settings applied. SDB/DB Creation/003

Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m sqlite and specifies one or more files containing SQL statements (this doesn’t require a specific switch). SDB will create a new SQLite DB (containing the settings table) at the default location as described by the property “sdb.dbname”. The new DB will have had the SQL statements applied and any errors generated reported
Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m dbms and no further input. SDB will create an empty DBMS DB at the default location as described by the property “sdb.dbname”.

Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m dbms  and specifies a configuration file containing database configuration settings, with the –c switch. SDB will create a new SQLite DB at the default location as described by the property “sdb.dbname”. A new DB will be created with the configuration settings applied.
If a DB already exists at that location a number will be appended to the end to ensure uniqueness.(SDB/DB Creation/010)

Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m dbms and specifies a configuration file containing database configuration settings plus one or more files containing SQL statements (this doesn’t require a specific switch). SDB will create a new DBMS DB at the default location as described by the property “sdb.dbname”. The new DB will be created and have had the SQL statements applied, with any errors generated reported.

Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m dbms and specifies one or more files containing SQL statements (this doesn’t require a specific switch). SDB will create a new DBMS DB at the default location as described by the property “sdb.dbname”. The new DB will be created according to the configuration values and have had the SQL statements applied, with any errors generated reported.
Verifies that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m dbms and specifies a configuration file (-c) with platsec settings in the DBMS section.
Verifes that when the user calls SDB with the mode –m dbms and specifies a configuration file (-c) with SQlite specific configuration settings in the DBMS section.
Verifies sensible output when template file does not exist
Verifies sensible output when template file specified is actually a directory
expected_output: Template is not a valid file
